title: Note Pitch
content: Music wouldn’t sound very good if it was all the same pitch, so we need to be able to tell the musician what note to play. We use staves for this (staff singular), which are 5 straight lines drawn horizontally across the page.

title: Staves
content: Each staff has its own pitch, which it gives to any note which lies on it. The staves’ notes are, in order from bottom to top, EGBDF. The mnemonic used to remember these is Every Good Boy Deserves Fruit - the bottom staff’s note is E, the second from bottom is G, and so on.

title: Spaces
content: The spaces between the staves also have their own pitches - from bottom to top, F, A, C and E. There’s no mnemonic to remember these pitches, just remember it spells FACE!

title: Ledger Lines
content: Some notes have pitches beyond what can be shown on the staves. If this happens, we draw a small line on the note, which acts as a mini staff just for that note.
